characters: TWO BRIGHT CIRCLES IN A SEA OF DARKNESS
THE COVER OF CONDE MAST TRAVEL MAGAZINE
THE COVER OF THE ADELPHIA CABLE INSIDER NEWSLETTER
"HE TOOK THE SHIRT OFF MY BACK AND I'D GIVE IT TO HIM AGA
THE COVER OF PHILADELPHIA CITY COLLEGE'S ALUMNI NEWS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forklifts RUMBLE. Workers WIPE FRAME. All the bustle and  cacophony of a major seaport. We FIND ourselves focusing on ONE LARGE CRATE. With the  GRINDING of gears, a crane lifts it off the dock and carr it onto a ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through night-vision binoculars, CHARLIE CROKER, 28, watc the mysterious crate. Charlie is young to run his own cre but he's a born leader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWISH PAN TO: LYLE, 21, brilliant and punctilious, finger the keyboard of his strap-on supercharged laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got the orbital data and SV  clock corrections for each satellite  that gets the signal. That'll make  my reading as solid as the Precise  Positioning Service that only the  D.O.D. can use. We're talkin' 100  meter horizontal accuracy, 156 meter  vertical accuracy, .340 nanoseconds  time accuracy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWISH PAN TO: STEVE, 30, bearded. Steve has an arrogant  confidence mixed with the hint of a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't he talk like a person?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Because he's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do need one more thing, Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone to turn the goddamn homing  device on. No signal, no score.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Steve) Where're the Italians?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver is HANDSOME ROB, 30. Riding shotgun is HALF-EA 35, immersed in a book: Albert Einstein Creator & Reb Half-Ear is a large black man with a Southern accent and hearing aid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A book. It's called reading. You  should try it some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handsome Rob holds up three fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna read something. Read between  the lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well here's something even you can  relate to. Albert got a lotta trim.  That genius thing is a babe magnet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme see that book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The final member of the crew, JOHN BRIDGER, 50s, is a tas man buying a very tasteful, and very expensive, diamond  necklace. The saleswoman wraps it up as he dials a number his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STELLA BRIDGER, 27, crushingly attractive, has just stepp out of the shower, hair still wet, body wrapped in a towe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sending you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Does it smell nice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But it's sparkly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it come with a receipt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm having it sent to you from the  store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (toweling her hair) Why not bring it by yourself? We  could have dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves the store and heads for the HOTEL ELEVATOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be a long trip. I'm in Genoa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't like the sound of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me guess. Checking out the  birthplace of Christopher Columbus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With your parole officer's approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps into the elevator. Rides up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I've paid my P.O. my last  visit. I liked the guy, but we never  really connected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you into, Dad? Don't break  my heart. You told me you were  through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After this, I swear to you, I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You promised me. Daddy, don't do  this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator door opens, Bridger steps out and starts dow the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's going to be fine. I've  got to go now. I love you. Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He clicks off then uses his card key to step into the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He eyes Charlie, who looks pretty tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Italians?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, they'll come through.  You can trust these guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trust everyone. It's the devil  inside them that I don't trust. (then, to Charlie) Got a sec?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They step inside, Charlie closing the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you feeling, boss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. I'm fine, fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger seems amused by that answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what fine, stands for, don't  you? Fucked-up, Insecure, Neurotic,  and Emotional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've become quite the philosopher  since you quit drinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like me sober?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm glad. Makes you a better  thief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger pulls out a fine cigar, still in its wrapper, han it to Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For after the haul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope I get to fire it up. If Steve's  Italians are a no-show, it's three  months prep down the shitter and  I've dragged you out of retirement  for nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is kinda nice. You being the  boss with all the worries, me just  along for the ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't you sweet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the other side of the door, they HEAR --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie takes the binoculars from Steve. He SEES TWO ITAL CUSTOMS INSPECTORS climbing onboard the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Italians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. Dixie cups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dixie cups?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I toss 'em away if there's a problem  down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In ITALIAN, the Inspectors quiz the NERVOUS CAPTAIN about the mysterious crate. One Inspector takes a crowbar and yanks out several strip of plywood, REVEALING unmarked cardboard boxes inside. Th other Inspector pulls out one of the boxes and tears it o It is filled with tomatoes. He takes a bite out of one. Nods. Everything seems to be order. The Captain looks  relieved. The inspector closes the cardboard box but... Watch carefully now, because as he does this, he hits a p button on a small HOMING DEVICE and stuffs it in with the tomatoes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Lyle's computer screen, a pulsating dot appears, BEEPI sending out precise longitude and latitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For those about to rock, we salute  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie dials his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handsome Rob answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get rich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handsome Rob pulls over. They're at the port. They can se the mysterious crate being lowered into the ship's hold. Half-Ear climbs out, taking a large duffel bag with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain is doing his final checks before launch. OUR  CAMERA DROPS to --

dialogues.speaker: BENEATH THE WATER
dialogues.text: where we FIND Half-Ear, in scuba gear, applying Nitramon  explosive primer to the hull of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plowing through thick brush that breaks out onto a seclud beach. Handsome Rob is still behind the wheel but now Ste is in the passenger seat. Lyle, in the back, is still on laptop, legs fidgeting like a drummer on meth. POP goes h bubble gum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you chill out back there? You'd  make a hummingbird nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half-Ear finishes up. Speaks into the headset inside his  gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm done. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy that. Enjoy the ride, cowboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half-Ear grabs onto the bottom rung of a ladder that is b to the side of the ship as it launches off the dock and i deeper water.

dialogues.speaker: TWO BRIGHT CIRCLES IN A SEA OF DARKNESS
dialogues.text: Coming closer... becoming clearer... It's Charlie and Joh Bridger, in scuba gear, riding torpedo-shaped Dive Propul Vehicles (DPVs) that pull them through the deep blue sea a good 5 m.p.h. Both DPVs drag equipment bags. A Global Satellite Positioning Device is mounted on the  handlebar of Charlie's DPV, being fed information via Lyl laptop. A circle pulsates on the monitor, a beacon to the crate in the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half-Ear still clings to the ladder. It's a wild ride. Through the headset inside his gear, he HEARS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get ready. 3. 2. 1. Drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half-Ear lets go of the ladder. The ship's propellers spe by just above his head. WHOOSH. He removes a radio-controlled detonator. Hits the button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hull of the boat EXPLODES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very neat hole on the bottom of the boat beneath the cr is opened. Water RUSHES IN and the crate falls right thro the cavity, vanishing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The huge, heavy crate drops down... down... hits the bott

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SHIP
dialogues.text: Chaos rules. She's taking on water fast. No way to save h The captain orders the dinghy lowered into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parked in the sand at the top of the bay. Steve looks out the bay through infrared binoculars. The ship is going down. The crew on the dingy head back t the port, which is in the opposite direction of this beac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DPVs are now attached by a tether to an underwater li bag that is used to move heavy loads through water. The crate is surrounded by our three diver-bandits. Using crowbars they pull apart the plywood. The cardboard boxes of tomatoes dump out, tomatoes spilling everywhere. And now we see what was hidden between the boxes... A large safe. They move like clock-work. Half-Ear aims an underwater li at the dial. Charlie drills a small hole near the dial. John peers inside a horoscope and lines up the three whee of the combination lock... until the door pops open. As they stare at what's inside, they speak into their  headsets, heard by all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "That for which all virtue is sold.  And almost every vice -- gold."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now we see the contents of the safe: 160 glistening G BRICKS. Made in Singapore, they weigh 25 pounds and each is decorated with the face of an exotic Balinese girl. We talking thirty million dollars worth of gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They holler and high-five and it's just a great moment to alive. Steve takes another peek through his infrared  binoculars and sees -- The last vestiges of the ship hang above the waterline, t disappear.

dialogues.speaker: A LITTLE LATER
dialogues.text: The gold is now stacked and secured on the lifting bag. They attach an underwater parachute to the bag and hook a hose from an air tank into press of a pressure release va which cause the parachute to INFLATE. Looking like a hot-air balloon underwater, the whole thin floats up about fifteen feet. Half-Ear holds onto its sid going along for the ride. Then Charlie and John Bridger speed off on the DPVs which are tethered to the inflatable bag. As they glide through the water towards the secluded beach, we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Humvee climbs into the mountain ranges of the Alps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gold is in three crates in the cargo bay. Handsome Rob and Steve are still up front. The others are the back seats, the divers out of their scuba gear. They pouring champagne into paper cups; except for Bridger who abstains. He holds up his empty cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is John and I'm a very rich  alcoholic. And I'm going to live my  life one very rich day at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, John!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh and pound their fists against the roof of the  Humvee. Charlie pulls out the cigar Bridger gave him. As  Bridger lights it for him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You planned this one down to a t,  kid. It's a gift. You saw the big  picture, made contingencies, covered  the angles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing this, Steve looks a little jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, you made thirty million dollars  in gold drop out of sight without  holding a gun. Who else could've  pulled that off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could've. I had big shoes to  fill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fill the shoes but don't follow the  footprints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talking about? You've  lived the life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My life's been nothing but fake IDs,  fake business cards and divorce  papers. This is the only thing that's  real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger shows him a photograph of Stella that he keeps in his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella's a beautiful girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's amazing. And I spent half her  childhood in prison. This is a once  in a lifetime haul, Charlie. Bring  down the curtain after this one.  Make a new life. Find someone amazing  and be there for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the advice escapes Bridger's mouth --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Jeep thunders out of a hiding place in the trees and bl the road. The Humvee brakes to avoid running into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Click. That's the sound of a gun cocking as it's pressed  against Handsome Rob's temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone acts stupid and his brains go  on the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They see the two Italian Inspectors jump out of the Jeep, 47s leveled at the crew. Steve has double-crossed them. ON THE CREW: shocked would be a good place to start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell do you think you're  doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry Charlie. But I want the box of  Cracker Jack all to myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Italians pull the crates of gold out of the back of t Humvee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not thinking this through.  It's a stupid move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think so? Well you're the brilliant  one. The Master Planner. Isn't that  so, John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve climbs out of the Humvee, gun still on Handsome Rob the AK-47s aimed at the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet on the wrong horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll hunt you down. You're gonna  regret this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safely outside, Steve turns his gun on Bridger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No regrets, Dixie cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM. He shoots Bridger in the head. Just like that. The Italians follow suit, AK-47s SCREAMING out bursts of  full automatic fire at the crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They duck for cover as the vehicle is riddled with gunfir Glass shatters. Bullets ricochet. They're in the epicente of hell. Handsome Rob jerks the steering wheel and stomps the gas. Driving blind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Humvee hits the side of the Jeep, grinds alongside it metal tearing against metal. The Humvee's right side tires precariously hover by the c and the raging water below. The gunners keep FIRING. Bullets rip into the Humvee's ti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It almost escapes, but it can't make it on shredded rubbe It careens off the road and --

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: The Humvee plummets through the air and plunges into the  raging river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water cascades in through the open windows. They're throw around as the Humvee rides the rapids. WHAM. The passenge door caves in as the Humvee rams into a large rock then i swept further downstream. Through the foam and spray, Cha looks over to Bridger. He's dead. The torrent ROARS. Only their chests and heads are above water. And that's n all. There's a WATERFALL AHEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Humvee is palmed in its deadly embrace and hurled ove It cartwheels into the pool below, sending up a huge geys of water. It sinks out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crates of gold are now inside the Italians' Jeep. Ste climbs in, leaving the crew for dead.

dialogues.speaker: SAME TIME
dialogues.text: The Humvee strikes the surface bottom with an ominous thu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jeep jerks to a stop. A door opens and the bodies of two Italians, shot dead, are dumped out into the mud. Steve is alone now. Just him and the millions in gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water entombs them. Blood from Bridger's fatal gunsho mists the water red. They manage to get the door open. They start to swim out Charlie won't go without Bridger. He grabs his friend's b and pulls it up with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drag themselves ashore, Handsome Rob helping Charlie pull Bridger's corpse. Charlie is shocked, tormented, gri and angry beyond description. Against the rocky embankmen he holds Bridger. Not wanting to ever let go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you would have told me that I  would spend the next three years  searching for Steve Bandell, I would  have said that was nothing. Cause I  would have spent a lifetime looking  for that bastard if I had to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOMEONE'S POV. A top of the line safe. The only light in office is the beam of a penlight on the dial. GLOVED HANDS spin the dial, feeling for "contact points", areas on the dial where a slight resistance can be felt - if you have the touch. NEW ANGLE. A woman holds the penlight in her teeth while  trying to crack the safe. It's Stella Bridger, now 30.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: Three Years Later Philadelphia

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She manipulates the dial. Click. She grabs the safe's lev and swings the heavy steel door open, her face a mixture pride and relief. But before we see what's inside -- LIGH TURN ON. TWO COPS lurk at the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always work in the dark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzz of the fluorescents throws me  off. She's all yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops come closer and only now do we realize that they on the same team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. Chris Perley couldn't crack  it. Neither could Michael Hoyt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you know who to call first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're expensive, Stella. Those guys  cut us a break on subpoena jobs.  Goodwill, community service...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I do it for the money. I'll  send you the bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you want to see what's inside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never look. Bye, guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as she walks off, they do look -- at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car RISES INTO FRAME on a bustling street: a 1960 Mini  Cooper S., a worldwide motoring icon. Its shape crouches to the ground and its tiny 10-inch wheel-at-each-corner g it the legendary Mini look. If when you see its headlights and classic grille it does bring a smile to your face, then you've got no automobile soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella takes on the road like someone who loves to be beh the wheel of a car that claimed victory in the Monte Carl Rally three times. She passes a minivan, a breeze with th Mini's quick, go-kart-like handling. She searches for a parking space on a street lined with S Sees a spot, it's not really a space, just a gap between gas guzzlers, there's no way any car could squeeze in. Brake. Shift. Hard turn. She parallel parks the Mini with ease. She's right in front of --

dialogues.speaker: HER SHOP
dialogues.text: Antique keys and locks dominate the storefront window wit the name of the shop stenciled across the glass: BRIDGER  LOCK AND SAFE COMPANY. Stella hops out of the Mini. With poised walk she heads inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is filled with old cast-iron safes she has rebuilt alo with some new models. Stella's RECEPTIONIST greets her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four minutes, forty-three seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's on the line-up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2:00. Home safe in Fairmount Park.  Owner died and the wife never knew  the combination. And Todd Milliken  called. He has a prototype combination  lock he wants you to test out tomorrow  morning. Says he added two false  contact points on the tumbler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him if I don't have it opened  in six minutes flat, breakfast is on  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's a Charlie Croker in your  office. He said you two know each  other. (an aside) And he looks pretty fine for a white  boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without a response, Stella heads over to --

dialogues.speaker: HER OPEN OFFICE DOOR
dialogues.text: and sees him fiddling with her collection of safe doors t line the shelves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie Croker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns around. Smiles. Charming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Stella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Refresh my memory. After you came to  see me and told me what happened to  my father, I told you I never wanted  to see you again, didn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. You did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'm a little confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first it seems that Charlie's words have no effect on  her, but then he notices that her hands are trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can tell you where he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in Los Angeles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't respond. Doesn't ask him to go on, doesn't as him not to. So he goes on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gold bricks he stole from us  were minted in Singapore and decorated  with the face of a Balinese girl.  I've had my tentacles out and got a  call from a friend of mine and your  father's, Philly Steak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella remembers him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was little he would play poker  at the house and drop quarters under  the table for me to find.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He got word from an L.A. connection  named Skinny Pete that a gold dealer  has been buying bricks with the  Balinese girl on them, three or four  at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever heard the expression, cut  to the chase?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tracked Steve down to an address  in the Hollywood Hills. He's changed  his last name to Frezelli. And get  this: he had a Worthington 1000  installed in the house before he  even moved in. We both know that you  don't install a Worthington 1000  unless you have something precious  to guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precious or not, I don't deal with  ill-gotten goods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We boosted that gold from a terrorist  group that was about to trade it for  bio-weapons. Now that doesn't exactly  make us Robin Hood, but maybe in our  own little way we were doing a good  deed. Problem is, no one in my crew  can handle that safe. And I need  someone I can trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you think that's me? Haven't you  heard that I work for the other side?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I heard is that you have your  father's touch. And he was the only  safecracker I knew who could open a  Worthington 1000.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a safecracker. I'm a  professional safe and vault  technician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're John Bridger's daughter. And  this is our chance to set things  right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sets her off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our chance? Who do you think you are  coming in here? Stealing the gold  isn't going to bring my father back  to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie comes out of her shop and starts down the sidewal Suddenly, Handsome Rob appears out of the crowd and is wa next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd it go with the chick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want her on the crew, Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta have her. Important piece of  the puzzle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There has to be someone else. What  about Bill Huchins?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doing ten long at Levinworth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red O'Reilly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chemo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin Hernandez?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handsome Rob stops Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want a civilian to screw  this up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has the skill. And the motivation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. She's emotional. You know  what happens when emotion gets into  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's emotional for all of us at this  point. Don't kid yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD WORTH has his back to the bar. He's a blue blood  trial lawyer with an ego that has more horsepower than a  Ferrari.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all in my patented sideways  glance. Like this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives a sideways glance to Stella; it's their first da

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hit each woman on the jury with  one of these. We make contact. And I  know exactly what they're doing.  Undressing me with their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a nightmare. Someone bumps into Stella, a mumbled,  "Excuse me." Nightmare continues...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The case is all but won. That's why  in jury selection I choose as many  women as possible. Except lesbians,  of course. I can tell in sixty seconds  if they're a lesbian. Want to know  how I know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they don't undress you with their  eyes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precisely. Like that waitress right  there. See? She's looking at me right  below my belt. Definitely not a  lesbian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A waitress is indeed looking below Richard's belt. But St notices that she was only looking because Richard's zippe is all the way down. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am fly. And I'm da bomb. Just wait  until later tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a BUSBOY stumbles and a tray of drinks fall, soa Richard's suit in red wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be. Moron. What the hell's  wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an accident. I'm very sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the manager? Richard Worth  is not paying to have his suit  cleaned. Damn. (to Stella) I'm going to... I don't believe this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts off to the bathroom and as soon as the space he was occupying empties, Charlie fills it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think your date's going pretty  well, what do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shoots him a look that could reverse global warming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? I come here all  the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Lawyers, Judges, my kind of  crowd. See that gentleman there, he  sentenced me to 90 days in county  once. We need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you need to listen. I want you  to leave. Got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I paid valet parking prices to  get in here, not to mention a twenty  spot to the busboy to spill that  drink on Mister Zipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You -- I don't believe this. You  paid someone to spill that drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, you paid for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie returns her wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't notice it was me who bumped  into you earlier, did you? Anyway, I  was hoping we could get to know each  other a little better before we leave  for Los Angeles. I already booked  your flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You truly are a fatuous, odious man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea what you just said,  but I like the sound of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well maybe you'll understand this.  Hit the road, Jack --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or you'll be sorry, Charlie, cause  I'll kick you in the nuts so hard  that your voice will be as high as  my heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She means it, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm beginning to worry about this  whole relationship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll let you in on a secret. You  can't have a relationship with a  pickpocket, gold robber, or any kind  of thief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie looks away, lets her have her point. This whole t is getting pretty heated so when he turns back to her, he uses a whole new approach. His emotions are genuine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John wasn't just a man I crewed up  with, he was my friend, he was the  closest thing to a father I ever  had. I wish to God I could bring him  back. But all I can do is go after  this guy, the guy that killed him,  and hit him where he lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She feels the honesty in his words but before she can rep they're interrupted by --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything alright, Stella?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's back, red wine splotched on his suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Richard. Charlie. Charlie was  just saying goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But for now, Charlie is just staring at Richard, boring i to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you with something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry. I was just undressing you  with my eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, Charlie goes. Stella can't help but smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes home, having shed her date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes through a drawer and pulls out a package she has looked at for years. She opens it. Inside is the beautiful necklace that her father bought h in Italy. It brings tears to her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lies in bed, can't sleep. His phone rings. He picks up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's on the other end of the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in this for one thing, Charlie,  and one thing only. I want to see  the look on his face when his gold  is gone. He took my father from me,  I'm taking this; it's the best I can  do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella's Mini passes, weaves, tucks in between cars. She  drives like a madman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie feels like he's inside a video game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see Drive Defensively is your motto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. Jack Daniels never let  me down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slaps the dashboard of her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way you drive, I'm not  surprised you named your car after a  bottle of whiskey. Left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack Daniels was chief engineer of  the Mini. And I drive it exactly the  way it was meant to be driven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She whips down the avenue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs a left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going in circles. Who's tailing  you this week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The possibilities are endless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mini parks in the middle of the huge, empty lot that  surrounds Veterans Field, home of the Philadelphia Philli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're a little early. I didn't expect  us to get here quite that fast.  There...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Vespa pulls into the lot, headed their way. It's Lyle. Charlie starts the introductions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Lyle. Gearhead. He's who really  invented Napster...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below a Metallica poster, Lyle has fallen asleep on his d His roommate, Napster creator SHAWN FANNING, recognizable his trademark baseball cap, sneaks a peek at Lyle's compu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least that's how Lyle tells it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now they see a monster pick-up truck bouncing into th lot, MUSIC THUMPING from its Alpine at ear-bleeding level

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half-Ear. Explosives. He lost fifty  percent of his hearing in the fifth  grade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 10 year old boy stands in front of a toilet in the stal BOOM! Water geysers out of the bowl and soaks him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One M-80 in the toilet bowl too many.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some kids in the bathroom saw the whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was rad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now a RUMBLING in the distance. Stella looks. Sees a streaking their way, almost like a mirage in the heat wav coming off the pavement. Closer. Faster. A classic Mustan Its engine rumbles like a jackhammer. It's had some serio custom work done to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handsome Rob. Premier wheel man. He  once drove all the way to L.A. just  so he could set the record for longest  freeway chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handsome Rob's behind the wheel, flicks a cigarette butt his open window -- We watch it hit the pavement, ashes spark, and then behin the fallen butt we see that every lane of the 405 is fill with cop cars in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smashed the mark by twelve minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We now see Handsome Rob through the lens of a TV news  helicopter camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He got a hundred and ten love letters  sent to his jail cell from women who  saw him on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the cars converge in the parking lot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been a thief since I had baby  teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEVEN YEAR OLD CHARLIE is shoved against a chain link fen by a SIXTH GRADE BULLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cough it up, Charlie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie hands the bully a dollar bill. The bully puts it a wallet that is over-stuffed with cash and saunters off, laughing it up with his bully pals. Charlie turns to his grade classmate who sports a fresh black eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So much for lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need a dollar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought he took your last one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie holds up the over-stuffed wallet that he pickpock from the bully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I got lots more now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doors open simultaneously. Everyone out. The crew eyes St Charlie gets right down to business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Stella. She's working with  us on this one. IDs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handsome Rob hands out fake driver's licenses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading his) Melvin Lisp? Could I -- just once --  have a cool name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (also complaining) 220 pounds? Try 180.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try 'Deal A Meal'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even have a cool nickname.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough of this sewing-circle shit.  Phones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half-Ear hands out new cell phone to everyone and takes t old phones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philly Steak says these are clean as  a whistle. He also got us four dozen  internal chips with different numbers.  Change out the chips twice a day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Charlie hands out airline tickets --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We travel to L.A. separately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still haven't told us the most  important thing. What exactly is the  job, Charlie? And who exactly is  she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle and Half-Ear have been kept in the dark until now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Stella Bridger. And we're  finishing the job that we started in  Italy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're a little stunned at first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit. It's about time.

dialogues.speaker: LAX
dialogues.text: The crew deplane from five different airplanes, different air carriers. They disperse in separate vehicles. See Charlie at Avis,  renting a car. See Handsome Rob renting a U-Haul panel truck. See Stella on a hotel shuttle bus. See Half-Ear on the underground Metro Rail, taking the Re Line. See Lyle in a taxi, headed south on Figueroa Street. He  notices a YOUNG WOMAN HITCHHIKING. For a moment, their ey connect. She is a beautiful waif and the feeling sweeps  through Lyle: if only... But the taxi passes by. Charlie checks into Shutters, with its Victorian beach ho feel and oceanfront view. Stella's at the Peninsula in Beverly Hills with its opule lobby. Handsome Rob's at the Standard, with its kitschy decor an ironic style. He stares at a huge empty aquarium behind t front desk where a performance artist writhes and a DJ sp out rhythmic throbs. Very L.A. Half-Ear's at the new Renaissance Hollywood Hotel adjacen to the dramatic Babylon Gate and the Kodak Theatre. And Lyle's at the Downtown Bonaventure, riding up the gla elevator. Perfect gearhead hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The five of them sit in chairs on the balcony of his hote room. There's a sweeping view of the Pacific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need an in to get a video blueprint  of the interior. We're not going  into this place blind. Half-Ear, you  take the first surveillance shift.  Who goes in, who goes out, levels of  security, you know the drill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I also want audio surveillance on  his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll hack into the phone company's  central office remote observance  monitoring system and fool it into  thinking there's a legal tap on the  line. Reroute the digital copies of  his calls to our own listening post.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll burn through the night, have it  up and running before morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Handsome Rob) We need to know how long to get from  the house to Union Station downtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problemo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella. How much time will you need  with the safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have it open in five minutes  flat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not the same as opening a safe  for the cops. Your heart will be  pounding in your ears. Perspiration  on your fingertips. It's a whole  different ball game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get me to the safe, I'll open  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out over the ocean, the sun is in its death throes, bruis the sky a coiling purple and orange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nestled at the end of a cul-de-sac on Oporto Drive in the Hollywood Hills. Chrome. Glass. Carved wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The U-Haul panel truck is parked on the side of the road  that overlooks Oporto Drive and Steve's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been converted into their surveillance vehicle, the  back outfitted with monitors and surveillance equipment. Half-Ear peers through binoculars and says his notes into micro-cassette recorder. His binoculars focus in on the f that surrounds the perimeter of the property.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into recorder) We've got an anti-scaling fence.  Hardened, electroplated steel. Hacksaw  won't work. We'll need Nitramon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The binoculars SWISH PAN TO a guard booth where a guard k an eye on the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Armed guard. 9MM semi-automatic in  the holster. Security booth is  accessible and ideal for a triple  charger chemical grenade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The binoculars SWISH PAN TO four Rottweilers prowling the grounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Dogs. Why do black men hate  dogs? I'll tell you why, Charlie.  Because dogs are racist. That's a  natural fact. Someone else deal with  'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sea of cars, gridlock in L.A. Crammed in the middle of traffic meltdown is Handsome Rob's rental car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Timing out the getaway route. He's got a Thomas Guide on passenger seat and a stopwatch ticking away but he's goin nowhere fast. He futilely leans on the car horn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle's surveillance shift. He takes digital photos with a telephoto camera. ZOOMS IN on a security pad on the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into micro cassette  player) Advent Home Navigator Hybrid System.  Monitors 132 points for intrusion,  fire, and environmental hazards.  Best way around it is to get a back  door password, trip the alarm during  the heist, then call it in as a false  alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HAND turns the dial to a Worthington 1000 vault. The va opens and voila: stacks and stacks of gold bricks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same hand clutches a very heavy duffle bag. OUR VIEW  BOOMS UP to see Steve, three years older than when we las saw him, his beard shaved away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through his digital camera lens, Lyle watches Steve walk  towards his car: a Ferrari 550 Barchetta Pininfarina. It' the first time he's seen Steve in three years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into micro cassette  recorder) 15:25. There he is. He's gained 15  to 20 pounds living off our money.  And Handsome Rob, you're going to be  pissed when you see his wheels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle watches the security guard hit a switch in the guard booth. The gate rises like the blade of a guillotine in  reverse. The Ferrari zooms away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another route. Handsome Rob's rental car is in the left t lane waiting for the light to change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light finally is a green arrow but the lady in front Handsome Rob is so preoccupied with applying her make-up  that she doesn't go until he honks but by then it's too l as she makes it through the light but he doesn't. He checks his stopwatch. Simmers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a bikini, Stella lies on a lounge chair under a cabana reading a copy of Vogue magazine. But as we take a closer look, we see that she's really re the owner's manual for the Worthington 1000 safe which sh inserted in the fold of Vogue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie's shift. He sees a Latina housekeeper get into he car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into micro cassette  recorder) Housekeeper leaves at 17:30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. COIN & BULLION STORE - EVENING Steve bangs a fist against the steel security door that c the closed store. The steel door rises up and a Ukrainian named YEVHEN unlocks another door. He is the gold dealer  that Philly Steak told Charlie about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right on time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. COIN & BULLION STORE - EVENING Yevhen is 50 and like many in the gold trade, there isn't conspiracy theory that he doesn't embrace. As they make t way to a back room, he keeps his mouth in overdrive --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All those poor bastards out there  putting their life savings in banks  and S&Ls and mutual funds. What do  they think -- that when the collapse  comes they can depend on the  government? I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve motions to a security camera that looms down on the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the camera off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Just like you said. I  never tape you, you can see for  yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve sees the red light is off. He lays the duffel bag o table, unzips it, pulls out three 25 pound gold bricks wi the face of a Balinese Girl stamped on each one. As Yevhe inspects them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Governments are nothing more than  puppets on the strings of the  Trilateral Commission with their  twisted gods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yevhen retrieves a briefcase, opens it, presenting Steve  with stacks of Ben Franklins: $100,000 worth. As Steve  inspects the cash --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, it's so obvious that in a  world where NAFTA can overturn the  Supreme Court, not to mention  Microsoft's nefarious financial  machinations, this, is our only  refuge; gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve closes the briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus a little walking around money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fender bender in the middle of an intersection has traf backed up for miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handsome Rob checks the latest time on the stopwatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through night-vision binoculars Charlie sees a (different security guard open the gate as Steve returns. He watches Steve go inside his house. Through the windows he sees him use a remote to turn on a TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A freeway sign says: UNION STATION 1/2 MILE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANDSOME ROB can see the exit up ahead, but traffic is so backed up and going nowhere that it feels like it's a hun miles away. And it's not even rush hour. Just life in L.A Idling on the freeway, he looks at the drivers in the car beside him. He sees a businesswoman reading the Wall Stre Journal. Sees a man with his finger deep, deep up his nos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's a grenade launcher when you  need one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our crew walks along the pathways of Japanese gardens tha wind along outside the restaurant. It's a breathtaking vi from high in the Hollywood Hills. Some tourists take in t vista.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter what time it is. It's  either bad traffic, peak traffic, or  slit-your-wrists traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta ride the Metro-Rail, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure it's ideal for carrying a  ton of gold, genius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your guesstimate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we had all green lights, fourteen  minutes. But in the twenty times  I've done it, the average is thirty- two minutes, with a top time of fifty  minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we'll travel like Rockefeller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't know where Charlie is going with this, but the been around him long enough to know it's going somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When cars first started catching on,  workers on tall ladders would use  these swiveling colored boards for  traffic signals. Now whenever  Rockefeller would take the drive  from his mansion to his office on  Wall Street, the workers would make  sure that he got green boards all  the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we get all green lights?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see what I can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know that the first traffic  signal to be patented was invented  by a black man named Garrett Morgan? (to Charlie) You're not the only one who watches  the History Channel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We still need an in to get the video  blueprint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carpet cleaners? Gutter cleaners?  Flower delivery?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll never get by the guard unless  they're certain it's legit. I'm  thinking cable TV. We cut his cable,  he calls the cable company. We show  up. Send a cable technician into the  house with a pinhole video camera  while we get a feed through an RF  antenna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who plays cable technician? Steve  thinks we're all dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Stella knows that's not exactly true. He doesn't thin Stella is dead; he doesn't know her at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're all dead, I guess I'm the  man for the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you up for it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In for a penny, in for a pound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Service trucks pull into the lot. Technicians are getting out, finishing their shifts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handsome Rob behind the wheel. Lyle shotgun, aiming his  digital camera at the exiting workers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you. He claims he named  it Napster because his hair is so  nappy underneath that cap of his.  But I know the real reason. It's  because I was NAPPING when he stole  the idea from me. I should've been  on the cover of Wired magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you clam up. You'd give a  woodpecker a headache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the Napster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. You're the Napster. Heads up:  cable chick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They see a female service tech getting out of her work tr Lyle zooms his camera lens in on her Adelphia Cable work  shirt. It has BECKY sewn in above her right breast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becky. Nice name. I wonder what she  calls the other one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's such a mystery why you don't  have a girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a girlfriend. Unfortunately  even though the relationship ceased  in an objective reality, it's still  going on in my mind. (tapping his head) That woman's lived in here rent-free  for four years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle takes a few more pictures of Becky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. All we need now is a work shirt  like this one and a service truck  like that one. You think Stella will  be able to pull it off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have my doubts, but there's no  talking to Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he's been inserting his hard  drive into her software. Clouds the  judgment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows better than to mix business  with pleasure. (getting out of the  car) Only I'm allowed to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To get a work shirt and a service  truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle watches him stroll over to Becky and strike up a  conversation in the parking lot. Lyle can't hear what's b said, but Becky smiles, and lest we forget, his name is  Handsome Rob for a reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OUR CAMERA FOLLOWS a trail of clothes, hastily littered,  that lead to the cable chick's bed. Lit candles are on th bedside table. The couple is asleep under a tangle of she Handsome Rob has clearly mixed business with pleasure. Hi eyes flash open. He slips out of bed. Pulls on his pants. Reaches into her pants and removes her key chain. He selects the key to her service truck and does an old t he blows out one of the candles and presses the key again the warm wax, making a clear impression of the key's ridg He returns the key chain. Takes a couple more steps, past her panties, past her bra and. He snags her work shirt. Then he's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using locksmith equipment, he cuts a key that matches the impression on the candle wax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella, wearing Becky's work shirt, arrives before any ot workers. Using the key Handsome Rob made, she unlocks the door to the cable truck and gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cable truck pulls over. Charlie and Lyle climb into t back where they can't be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cable repair truck pulls over, parking down the stree from Steve's house. Charlie gets out. He quickly uses a crowbar to lift up a  sidewalk cement grate that says CABLE on it. Inside are c wires that feed the street. He crouches over and uses pli to disconnect one of the cables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drifts into the kitchen for a cup of coffee. He hits t remote control for a TV. It turns on but there's nothing snow. He goes into the living room and checks out the plasma TV The cable's not working in here, either. He hits an inter button on his telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECURITY GUARD answers the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do for you, Mister  Frezelli?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cable's out. See if you can get  someone over here to fix it'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finds the number and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle monitors a digital copy of the security guard's call that's being routed to his laptop. Then he takes off his  headphones and tells Charlie and Stella:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. I've never heard the Muzak  version of Purple Haze before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When's the appointment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thursday between 9 a.m. and 3 p.m.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie dials a number on his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The security guard answers the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm calling from Adelphia Cable.  I understand your service is out and  an appointment was set up for  Thursday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well we have a technician working in  your area who finished with an  appointment earlier than expected.  Will someone be there for the next  hour?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. That'd be great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our technician will see you then.  Have a nice day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's check the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella, you're going patriotic today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle puts an American flag pin on her work shirt. Then he hits keys on his laptop and an image pops up on his monit via an RF antenna: the POV of the pin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got cable lines in the kitchen,  living room, bedroom and a cable  modem on the computer in the office.  Try to get a 360 look at each room.  And walk slowly or the image will  streak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle hands her some papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I printed these up to look like  paperwork from Adelphia. When you're  done, ask him to sign and date the  bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella looks very tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie seems amused by that answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what fine, stands for? Fucked- up, Insecure --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella joins in with him... STELLA & CHARLIE Neurotic and Emotional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other a moment... and smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While the others deal with the cable, Handsome Rob and Ha Ear drive down Sunset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's our spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pull up in front of a strip joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girls girls girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half-Ear pulls a switchblade out of his boot and puts it the glove compartment. Handsome Rob gives him a questioni look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philly Steak said we'd be frisked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the doorway of a back room they're frisked by a B MAN. He's very thorough, digging hard into their crotches

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scowls) Y'got a great job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pays the rent, asshole. You got a  problem, talk to Skinny Pete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the door to the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we meet SKINNY PETE, who is the FATTEST MAN YOU'VE  EVER SEEN. He takes up an entire couch in the rear of the room. His catcher's-mitt-sized hands motion them to come closer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philly Steak sent you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His voice is raspy, it's like a climbing-ten-floors-effor just for this guy to get out the words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So was I right-on about the gold  bricks or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's really not what I'm here to  talk about. Philly Steak said you  could get us some supplies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fattest man you've ever seen attempts a nod, triple-c colliding like a train wreck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A four inch can of Nitramon. Nitramon  primer. Detonating cord. Two triple  charger chemical grenades. Launcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine p.m.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we hang here? Check out the  dancers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's going down here. I don't  shit in my own yard, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I take a whizz off the deck  sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his distended belly and bursting shirt, his eyes gla with repletion, Skinny Pete writes down an address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five thousand dollars. And don't be  late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking at a monitor, one of Steve's security guards sees the Adelphia repair truck pull up to the gate. He hits a  button and the gate rises, beckoning it inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella heads up the driveway, apprehension painted on her features. Lyle is hidden in the back. She parks next to the Ferrari and finds herself surrounde by the four Rottweilers. They snarl and flash their teeth outside her door until a shrill WHISTLE yanks their atten to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where Steve has just stepped out the front door. The dogs immediately back off. Stella gets out of the truck as Steve walks over, smiling her. She comes face to face with the man who killed her father

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right. They won't bother  you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not sure she's going to be able to speak or pull th off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. I'm used to running into  all sorts of dogs on my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds out a hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Steve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes his hand. She hates this, feeling his skin tou hers, but she can't betray her feelings. He stands there moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to show me the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Course. This way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She enters, moving her body to give the pinhole camera a  full sweep of the entryway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to check the cable modem  first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle watches Stella and Steve on his laptop via the pinho camera and hears them talking through his headphones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve leads Stella down the marbled hall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll show you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They step into the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns her body so the mini-lens  can stare at the gleaming black  Worthington 1000 safe. Then she goes  up to his desk and pretends to work  on the cable line that feeds into  his computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at her as she bends down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cable guy who hooked this up  weighed about 300 pounds, didn't  wear any underwear, and his pants  slung a little too low if you know  what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries her best to ignore his flirtatious stare and hi words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There we go. Now onto the TVs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle sees a perfect view of the main hallway as Stella wa down it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He escorts her inside. She works on the cable connection the plasma TV. Finishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it fixed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn it on and see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back at the spot where Charlie disconnected the cable. Wearing a headset with a mic, he gets the word from Lyle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie reconnects the cable just as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve turns on the TV and the picture is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it looks like you're all set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve stares at her a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have we met before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's hoping to get out as quickly as she can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. Sign here, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him the paperwork and a pen. He signs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You read my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. I meant that I need you to  put the date by your signature. It's  the 26th.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you meant. (he smiles) This might seem a little sudden,  but... would you like to have dinner  with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that'd be a very good  idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Is there some kind of cable- rule against dating customers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's my rule. I don't accept  dates from men I've just met. I've  only known you five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I guess I'll have to sabotage  my cable over and over again until  you get to know me better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's being charming, and she has to act like he is being  charming, but she really wants to throw-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm just talking about dinner.  Friday night. It's no big deal. If  you don't like me, you never have to  see me again. You know I'm not going  to stop until you say yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella drives in heavy traffic down Sunset. Charlie and L are in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it was tough in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He touched my hand. And he came-on  to me. That slimy, disgusting man  came onto me and I had to pretend  that I liked it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella keeps her eyes forward, on the road, so Charlie an Lyle can't see her face. But Charlie catches her reflecti in the rearview mirror and watches a tear glide down her  cheek. She wipes it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do know what this means... I've  created our window of opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. When Steve leaves Friday  night, we go in. By the time he  realizes you've stood him up, we'll  be long gone with the gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A different world. A different vibe. That feeling in the  gut: you don't belong here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handsome Rob drives, Half-Ear in the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skinny Pete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy makes Jabba the Hut look  like a spokesman for the Subway  Sandwiches' diet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pull over in front of the apartment building that Pe sent them to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying not to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half-Ear hits the buzzer for the apartment number on the  paper from the fat man. The door to the building buzzes i response and they go inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Climbing stairs. From behind closed doors: TVs, crying ba violent yelling. They start down a hallway. Ahead of them door opens and a suitcase is put in front of the doorway. The door closes. They don't even get a glance at whomever inside. They go to the suitcase. Half-Ear clicks open the lock fo just a peek. He sees the goods. Handsome Rob starts to slide an envelope of cash under th door frame. Its sucked out of his hand by someone on the  other side of the door and disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half-Ear carefully deposits the suitcase into the trunk o the rental car. Handsome Rob closes the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drive slow. We crash and we're a  crater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handsome Rob keys the ignition. The beam of his headlights illuminate TWO HOMEBOYS. TWO M step out of the shadows, one right up to the passenger's  door window. That one taps a 9 MM against the glass. Half-Ear lowers the window. The homeboy pats one hand aga the faux-leather inside of the door, his other hand clutc the weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you put in the trunk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The homeboy, bugging on crank, is not one to be fucked wi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just gimme the keys before I pop a  cap in your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handsome Rob takes the trunk key off the chain and passes over to Half-Ear... who nervously drops it onto the carpe floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half-Ear reaches down for the key... but in the flash of eye... moving so fast it almost doesn't register... we se him yank his switchblade from his boot, unleash its blade and stab it down into the homeboy's hand. The knife goes  through his hand and lodges into the faux-leather interio of the door. The homeboy suffers as Half-Ear whacks the gun out of his other hand -- while Handsome Rob keys the ignition and gu it. The other homeboys are already POPPING OFF SHOTS at the c with semi-automatic handguns. Half-Ear hits the deck. Gla shatters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullets slam into the trunk, illuminating the darkness wi streaks of light from the bullet holes. They barely miss suitcase filled with explosives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The homeboy is still attached to the car door by the knif His legs scurry to keep up with the moving vehicle but it going too fast so pretty soon he's being dragged. Bullets whiz by him. He cries out in agony until Half-Ear has the time to yank out the knife and the homeboy rolls away on pavement. The car makes a sharp right at the next block and pulls o The U-Haul is waiting for them. They get out of the rental car and open its trunk. Half-E sees the bullet holes that surround the suitcase. An inch closer and they would've been a crater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get in with the suitcase. Charlie is behind the whee he's been waiting for them. He hits the gas. They take of leaving the shot-up rental car behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like that went without a hitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An edited loop of the exterior and interior of Steve's ho plays on Lyle's laptop. The crew is huddled around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle, what's the distance from the  front door to the vault?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handsome Rob leans over to Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He only answers to The Napster now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not calling you The Napster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call him Half-Ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't my idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And him, Handsome Rob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's only cause he is Handsome  Rob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm The Napster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far? (sighs, gives in) The Napster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five hundred yards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So here's the riddle. How do we get  over a ton of gold from the vault to  the getaway car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How wide is the hallway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The video that Stella got of the hallway plays on the lap Lyle calculates:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only six feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OUR VIEW PUSHES IN FAST on Stella.

dialogues.speaker: MINI COOPER, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: She's driving. Pure concentration. Then: Tires spinning over a marble floor. Then: The sideview mirrors scraping wallpaper. Then: The thin car is like a missile firing RIGHT DOWN STEVE'S  HALLWAY, a hair-raising fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her idea brings a smile to her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack Daniels, straight up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could rumble right up the front  steps, bring the getaway car right  to the vault, and then straight to  Union Station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handsome Rob likes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll need three to hold the gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parked in the lot are shimmering Supercharged Mini Cooper a new model that still captures the legendary Mini look a feel. Half-Ear climbs in one Mini. Lyle into another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background, a large window overlooks the lot. Handsome Rob fills out the paperwork on the Mini he's ren while flirting with a petite COUNTER BABE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say you're a Maserati 250 S.  Just 4 cylinders but can go 0 to 60  in 4.2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as it's a convertible -- I  always like to have my top down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the same time, in the background, we see Lyle and Half Ear's Mini pull out of their parking spaces and BACK RIGH INTO EACH OTHER. Just a little bumper hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get out of their cars and start yelling at each othe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never seen 'em before in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. YEVHEN'S COIN & BULLION STORE - NIGHT Steve bangs a fist against the steel security door that c the closed store. The steel door rises up and once again  Yevhen unlocks another door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm in a hurry, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
