dialogues.text: INT. YEVHEN'S COINS & BULLION STORE - NIGHT It doesn't seem to matter if Steve's in a hurry or not, Y still runs at the mouth while heading into the back room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course the Florida vote rigging  was a CIA and Mob operation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with total disinterest) That a fact?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want facts? Fact: CIA officials  were allowed free -- and illegal --  access to official election material.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve puts his duffel bag down on the table. It THUDS. On again, he pulls out three gold bricks that each weigh 25  pounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now given the sordid history in Miami  of joint ventures between Central  Intelligence and the Mob, which led  to the unsuccessful attempts to kill  Fidel Castro and the successful  assassination of your President John  F. Kennedy, this conjunction raises  numerous red flags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'd love to hear more about it,  but like I said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, we'll have you out in  no time. The cash is on its way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve cocks his head, as if he could not have heard right

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On its way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My cousin is bringing it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your cousin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Cousin Mashkov.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on his way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, he will be here any  minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve looks up to the security camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tape's off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Believe me, he doesn't  want to be on video, either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yevhen. Didn't I tell you, many times,  that I never wanted to meet with  anyone but you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yevhen sweats a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But it's his cash. He uses  me to launder money. I'm just a  middleman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a middleman is supposed to stay  in the middle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you were early. Please. Don't  worry. It will be fine. My cousin's  a cool guy. Like I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you are, is a Dixie cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yevhen smiles quizzically, not sure if he's being complim or insulted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dixie cup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before the words are out of Yevhen's mouth, Steve grabs o of the 25 pound gold bricks and slaps it across Yevhen's  face, shattering his jaw. Yevhen's falls to the floor and Steve lifts the brick aga and rams it down onto his head with an ugly THUD. And again. And again. He then takes the gold brick -- slathered in blood -- and places it back in his duffle bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. YEVHEN'S COINS & BULLION STORE - TEN MINUTES LAT Yevhen's Ukrainian cousin, MASHKOV, stares down at the co Steve is long gone. Mashkov kneels down by the body and starts sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mashkov walks through a living room, past some lighting  equipment and a video camera and we get just enough of a  look to realize that a porno is being shot here but he  couldn't care less as he makes his way into the kitchen w His boss, DANYA, 60, the owner of this house, is eating a bowl of Frosted Flakes at the kitchen table. They speak i colloquial Ukrainian tongue that we SUBTITLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My cousin Yevhen was beaten to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm going to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop talking for a moment as one of the "ACTRESSES"  comes in, plops herself down next to Danya and pours hers a bowl of cereal. She puts her hand on Danya's leg. She's young and it's a disturbing image and we RECOGNIZE HER: s the HITCHHIKER who Lyle passed in the taxi ride down Figu Street when he first arrived in L.A. Danya goes back to speaking SUBTITLED UKRAINIAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what will you do when you find  this piece of shit who killed your  cousin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll hack off his limbs and bury him  while he's still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. But now we should stop talking  Ukrainian, it's rude to my girl. (switching to accented

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you tonight, Karen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then eat your Frosted Flakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (like Tony the Tiger) They're grrrreat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danya laughs pleasantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such a perfect girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But as she eats her cereal, we see a troubled, sad look o her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three Minis are parked inside: one red, one white, on blue. Handsome Rob and Stella are doing custom work under the hoods. Lyle is wearing the strap-on laptop and typing away. Half-Ear squeezes silver Haliburton suitcases into Minis' trunks as Charlie enters --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are our matchbox cars?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Souped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let their size fool you. These  were rally cars back in the day. 135  mph, 155 horsepower --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I get to drive one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you can't navigate your way  out of a parking lot. Here's your  ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls a blanket off a Vespa. Lyle points at Half-Ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he ran into me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not driving either. (to Stella) You ever got a speeding ticket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's put it this way: I can only  get insurance through companies that  advertise on TV at 3:00 in the  morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You drive. I drive. Charlie drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got us spots for three cars on a  car carrier and five first class  seats. Train 59 from Union Station  to New Orleans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's N'Or'lins, Yankee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the word on Rockefeller?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Traffic Control Center is on the  top floor of a building on Olympic  and Grand. They get their data from  pavement loop detectors and video  image vehicle detectors. That info  is fused together by specially  designed algorithms to predict traffic  conditions and control the traffic  lights. So all I have to do now is  change the data by creating my own  algorithm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do to help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to hard-wire into the  mainframes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Housed in a towering building on the corner of Olympic an Grand in the heart of downtown L.A. OUR VIEW RISES UP to rooftop, where WE FIND Charlie and Lyle. OUR VIEW MOVES IN CLOSER on Charlie, who adroitly picks t lock to an access door and they climb down a short set of steps into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From an equipment bag, Charlie pulls out a silent power d and uses it to remove an access panel from the AC vent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie leads, crawling through this tight space, his pat illuminated by the thin beam of a penlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A high-tech setting with a half-dozen workers overseeing large traffic information monitors that display multiple  images. OUR CAMERA PUSHES IN on the wall of monitors and then  BLACKNESS as OUR VIEW CROSSES to the --

dialogues.speaker: OTHER SIDE OF THE WALL
dialogues.text: Where the 70" tall mainframe computers are housed and run We see that the AC vent to this room is now open since Ch and Lyle have already snuck inside. They move fast. Charlie removes the rear panels of the  mainframes while Lyle adeptly hard-wires his laptop into computers. The laptop's screen lights up. Charlie fits two false panels where the rear panels of th mainframes used to be. Lyle pulls an innocent looking fil box out of his equipment bag. He places the box on a near shelf where it enjoys line-of-sight to the false panels. He punches a key on his laptop and the false panels and t filing box quietly clicks into action, communicating with his laptop via infrared. His laptop now shows a guiltwork thumbnail views from the traffic information monitors. Typing commands, Lyle is clearly operating on a higher  bandwidth than the rest us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B4 X TTratio, where Bi are Fisher's  linear discriminant function  coefficients, SpdRat is the speed  ratio, and TTratio is the travel  time ratio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea what you're doing.  Just do it fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. He hits the ENTER button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We own this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their motto: "Never closed. Never without a customer!" Th place has the same decor as it did 75 years ago. It's als spot where everyone minds their own business. One of the TIME WAITERS leads OUR CAMERA to a table in the back wher Mashkov sits across from a LAPD HOMICIDE DETECTIVE. He sl over an envelope of cash and a photograph of Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: $2000. And this is the new girl.  Fresh off the bus. One of Danya's  guys picked her up hitchhiking  downtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The detective checks out the photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those tits'd make Dracula rise from  his coffin at high-noon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all yours Saturday. You can  do whatever you want to her. Her  name is Karen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too generous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I needed a fast answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm the Shell Answer Man. A guy  who works the counter at your cousin's  shop told me that someone named Skinny  Pete had been asking around about  gold bricks with the face of a  Balinese girl on them. Same gold  bricks your cousin was buying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talked to this Skinny Pete?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you'd want a shot at him  first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handsome Rob does some final tune-ups on the Minis. Half-Ear loads a triple charger chemical grenade into a  launcher. Charlie steps into the U-Haul which is parked in here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle is fixing glitches on his computer program. Stella i doing her nails. Charlie looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want the safe cracked, don't  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I have to have perfect nails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Square tips have a more even surface area. Better grip, n slipping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you making this shit up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just let you in on a valuable trade  secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve called to confirm a 7:30  reservation at Ago's. And as for  your getaway, not even Rockefeller  had it so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's getting dressed for his date. We can tell by the way preens in front of the three sided full length mirror,  adorning himself in the most expensive fashion, that he i vain and arrogant man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three Minis pull out of the warehouse and head off do the road. The U-Haul follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leading the pack. He wears a headset and mic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Radio check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drives, Half-Ear in the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got cha, boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She follows behind Handsome Rob's Mini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loud and clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle drives. His Vespa is parked in the cargo bay with hi equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking sharp, Steve gets into his Ferrari.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The U-Haul is idling on the side of the street about a mi down from Steve's house. The Vespa is parked behind it. From up ahead, we see the Ferrari cruising down the windi road. As it passes by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle speaks into his headset:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For those about to rock, we salute  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From side streets, the Minis converge on the road and hea up towards Steve's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can feel the adrenaline already starting to course thr is body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it, guys. Moment of truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a sharp curve... and the moment that Steve's hou should come into view... he hits the brakes, his expressi turning to complete surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The neighbor across the street from Steve is having the  biggest party in town. The road is filled with parked car and arriving guests. Ain't no way they're blowing the gat launching chemical grenades or in any way robbing Steve's house in the midst of this.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE'S FACE
dialogues.text: As he takes this in, there's a KNOCK on the window. He tu Sees a uniformed VALET. Rolls down the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hear for the Baxter party,  sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the three Minis pull tight U-turns and head back t way they came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slaps his hand against the steering wheel, fuming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Stella?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She already knows what he's going to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I've got a date tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to fake it. Laugh at his  jokes. You need him to ask you out  again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A posh restaurant. As OUR CAMERA FINDS Stella and Steve, is laughing at something he said, faking her way through date. They're sitting at an intimate table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really make laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the lie like the compliment she wants him to thi it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So here's what I have lined up for  after dinner. We'll go to Club Deep.  The Ferrari always gets me to the  front of the line. We'll do a little  dancing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not tonight. I don't want to be out  late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the curfew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just say I've made some wrong  calls in the past. I like to take  things slow, cautious. Next time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. You have nothing to  worry about. You can trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trust everyone. It's the devil  inside them that I don't trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That saying strikes Steve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's an interesting saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her closely, really closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only person I've ever heard  say that. Used to say it all the  time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This worries her. Because of course, she used to hear it  from her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the table, he grabs her by the wrist, squeezes it l a vise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man named John Bridger. Where did  you pick up that phrase?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow. I don't remember. You're hurting  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Bridger was a thief. And he had  a daughter. About your age. He told  me that she took over a safe and  lock company that he used as a front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of my wrist. What is wrong  with you? It's just a saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve's voice is calm, so at ease that watching them you' think this was pleasant dinner conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wonder I liked you right away.  Just like I liked your old man, right  up until the moment I shot him in  the head. Now tell me who you're  working with and tell me the plan.  Do it now or we'll go for a ride and  I'll break every bone in your body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella intentionally knocks over a glass of wine. It shat on the floor. An emergency signal... Charlie, Half-Ear, Handsome Rob and Lyle appear around th table. Steve is shocked to see the men he left for dead three ye ago standing before him, very much alive. They pull up chairs from another table, encircling him fo tense and pointed talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something wrong, Steve? You look  like you want to call Ghostbusters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half-Ear furtively slides the switchblade out of his boot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's coming with us. You got a  problem with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine by me. But it's you that has  the problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you figure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've just blown the one thing you  had going in your favor, the element  of surprise. And I was surprised. (he laughs unpleasantly) Jesus Christ when I saw all you guys  come out of the woodwork. For a minute  I thought maybe you were ghosts. But  you're screwed now. (an arrogant sneer a  Half-Ear) Did you figure out how to take care  of my security guard? I'll hire five  more. (at Lyle) You know how to bypass my alarm  system? I'll have a new one installed  tomorrow. (at Handsome Rob) Does it tear you up inside seeing  what car I drive? I'll buy a matching  one in red. (at Stella) You think you can crack my safe?  You'll end up the same way as your  dad. (then to Charlie, all  smiles) Looks like Good Time Charlie's got  the blues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can wear that shit-eating grin  on your face, but I know under that  Versace shirt you're in a cold sweat.  And you're not going to sleep a minute  tonight. Cause you thought you'd  gotten away with it free and clear.  You thought you'd gotten rid of us.  You're the one who's screwed. Right  to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it your best shot. I'll outsmart  you every step of the way. And this  time, I'll bury you myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking the challenge) Get more guards. Change the alarm.  Buy a dozen Ferraris. We'll still be  here. Sleep tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie grabs a bread stick off the table and goes. The o follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door bursts open as the burly man we met earlier is  dragged inside at gunpoint. Five Ukrainians armed with MA 11 machine pistols storm the room where Skinny Pete works Mashkov walks behind the posse. He carries a duffel bag. takes in the sight of the fattest man he's ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in accented English) Do you know who I am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You work for Danya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. And you are gonna be straight  with me and everything's gonna be  okay. You fuck with me, I will be  ruthless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you to understand. I  want you to overstand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overstand... Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because if you don't overstand, I  will use this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mashkov nonchalantly opens the duffel bag and pulls out a short-handled ax. Skinny Pete sees dried blood on the bla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone was asking about gold bars  with a Balinese girl's face on them.  I want the name of this man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun shines over the ocean and the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew is gathered. Lyle, monitoring digital surveillan on his laptop, takes off his headphones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well we scared him alright. He's  flying the coop. His security guard  called Brink's Armored Car Service  to confirm a 5 p.m. pick up at his  house, then JetClub to confirm a  MD11 cargo plane departing from the  Imperial Terminal at LAX at 8 p.m.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confirmed? How'd we miss the first  calls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They must have been cellular. The  cargo plane is being chartered to  Mexico City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only place with worse smog and traffic  than L.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once the charter's in the air, he  could change the flight path to  anywhere. And good-bye gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so fast. This is good news for  us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good news?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes when you're up to your ass  in alligators you forget that you  started off trying to drain the swamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning what the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been trying to get to the gold  in the safe. Now the safe is coming  to us. We'll boost it in transit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He might as well have said they'll steal the Holy Grail b sunrise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie. He could take a dozen  different routes to the airport and  we have no idea which one. We can't  take out an armored truck during  rush hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're already set to do it. Napster:  how would you like to create the  biggest traffic jam in the history  of Los Angeles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gridlock every route except the  one we choose. Force the truck to go  exactly where we want it to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But where do we want it? We can't  shoot it out with armed guards in a  Brink's. We'd lose. And even if we  pulled it off, the cops would be all  over us, chasing us all the way to  Union Station. We're outmanned and  outgunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But not outsmarted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie hums with focused energy. There's a term for it i horse racing. When a thoroughbred is at peak condition, a twitching with eagerness to run, he is "on the muscle." T describes Charlie right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll do it like the Italian job.  We'll make thirty million in gold  drop out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're interrupted by Charlie's cell phone RINGING. This throws them all off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else has this number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one but us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still RINGING. Charlie decides to answer it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet PHILLY STEAK. Or at least meet the back of his neck. Because that's where he has a tatoo that says PHILLY STEA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (informing the crew) Philly Steak. (then into phone) Do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OUR CAMERA TRACKS AROUND to Philly Steak's face which is  weathered and as leathery as a football. An old school cr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yevhen. The Ukrainian gold, dealer.  You didn't, have to clip him, for  Christ's sakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clip him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me. You've gotta get out  of L.A. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talking about? We didn't  clip anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well Skinny Pete just called me.  Yevhen's cousin is under the distinct  impression that you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does he think that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you wanted, to know about  the gold with the Balinese Girl.  Plus I guess Pete was under duress.  This Ukrainian thinks he's Paul  Fucking Bunyan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know how to get in touch with  him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe there's a way we can play this  to our advantage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you out of your mind? Listen to  me, Charlie. Get out of L.A. Now.  Cause if there's one thing I know,  it's that you never mess with Mother  Nature, mother-in-laws, or mother- fucking Ukrainians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking of -- Five Ukrainians lock 'n load their MAC-11  machine pistols plus an M4 carbine with a 40mm grenade  launcher mounted beneath the barrel. Mashkov enters the r and tells the others in SUBTITLED UKRAINIAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to be on Train 59 for New  Orleans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure your source is good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The home where the porno was made. Karen, wearing a backp stuffed with her only belongings, creeps into the kitchen with two 3/4" videotapes in hand. She sets them down on the counter. They say MASTER TAPE o the labels. She opens the microwave oven. Puts the tapes  inside. Sets the timer for 60 minutes at the highest leve and presses the start button. As the videotapes start to cook, we watch Karen flee out door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The U-Haul is parked on the side of the noisy, congested  boulevard. A large metal sheet is now mounted on the side the panel truck. HIGH ANGLE. Parked behind the U-Haul are two of the Minis and Lyle's Vespa. We see traffic flowing through the busy intersection next to the vehicles. Then WE BOOM DOWN, rea fast, right into the black pavement and -- THROUGH THE DARKNESS and out the other side, so we are no underground in the middle of the --

dialogues.speaker: METRO RAIL TUNNEL
dialogues.text: where Half-Ear is at work, mounting Nitramon primer to th tunnel walls, Charlie assisting. They both wear orange  jumpsuits, plus headsets and mics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know Einstein's 7th grade  teacher told him he was a moron who'd  never amount to anything? Same as  mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still hope for that Nobel Prize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me, man. But I did get my college  diploma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit. I thought you dropped out  of high school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got my GED after Italy then just  kept going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you manage that, all the jobs  we've been pulling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit going to strip clubs. Went to  night school instead. City college  is all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you. That's a real feather  in your cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want to say anything to the  guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a RUMBLING SOUND in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secret's safe with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RUMBLING grows unbearable as a Metro roars closer,  headlights gobbling up the dark tunnel. They press themse into a crevice in the wall. With a ROAR and a gust of wind, the Metro howls by. It ma their jaws clatter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella's in the cargo area with Lyle who's working his la It's monitor displays a string of computer code. He HEARS over his headset:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Napster. How goes it up there? Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working on the Metro Rail system.  Almost ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handsome Rob's Mini is parked on the side of the winding  road. Using binoculars, he looks down onto Oporto Drive a Steve's house. Into his headset:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's quiet here. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nitramon is applied. Half-Ear closes his eyes. Charli observes him a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah huh. Just need a moment's  meditation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm about to insert a wire into a  detonator tube and if the wire touches  the sides of tube, we'll be blown to  Kingdom Come. Best to be at one with  yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take all the time you need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another moment, then Half-Ear sets to work. Charlie holds mini-flashlight, illuminating the intricate detonator. Ve carefully, he inserts a wire into a tube. Remember, the w must not touch the sides. The wire is half-way in when a LARGE SPIDER drops onto hi hand. Frozen, he ponders this. Charlie sees the spider, doesn't know what to do. Half-Ear studies the spider... then he closes his eyes ju a moment... relaxes... breathes in, breathes out... and t He leans forward, opens his mouth and clamps his lips ove the spider, comes back up. Finishes inserting the wire. Job done, he calmly opens his mouth. The spider puts a ha leg out and delicately explores his cheek. Half-Ear pluck it off just as delicately, depositing the spider on the w Charlie just shakes his head in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My work here is done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Brink's truck climbs the road towards Steve's house, fl by two BMW K1200LTA motorcycles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through binoculars, Handsome Rob is still keeping an eye Steve's house from the higher vantage point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front gate rises. The Brink's truck and motorcycles a let inside and head up the driveway. But then he sees a SECOND ARMORED truck drive up, also gu by two motorcycles. And a third Brink's followed by  motorcycles turns into the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a convoy of matching armored trucks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witnessing the twist of events through his binoculars. He speaks into his headset mic --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Problemo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of the crew is now all in the U-Haul. Lyle's man the laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's brought in three identical  armored trucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Decoys. It's like a shell game  on wheels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I reroute the truck if I  don't know which truck to reroute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The caravan of armored trucks and motorcycles now head do the driveway. The Ferrari follows behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handsome Rob sees the vehicles head east on Oporto. He re into his mike:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three Brink's trucks are leaving  with motorcycle escorts, plus Steve  in his Ferrari.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maddening frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're we going to figure out which  truck has the gold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie is just as frustrated... but in a tight spot he a comes up with an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can monitor the traffic video  cameras from your laptop, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the first camera the trucks  will go past?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle hits a command key and we now see the intersection o Woodrow Wilson Drive and Cahuenga where vehicles are driv under the traffic signal that a traffic video camera is  mounted to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cahuenga Boulevard. They all have to  cross that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The weight of the gold will lower  the suspension on the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first armored truck makes its way through the green l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle hits the keyboard and lines of measurements appear a the image of the Brink's truck. He strikes another key,  momentarily FREEZING the image. He makes a visual check o the top of the armored truck against the Cahuenga Bouleva street sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lines up with the top of the sign.  Next...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He unfreezes the first image just in time to check out th next armored truck in line. FREEZE. The top of this truck also lines up perfectly with the top of the street sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First two are the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The third Brink's truck makes its way through the  intersection, the Ferrari behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The third Brink's comes into the monitor's view. FREEZE. The top of the truck is below the top of the street sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's our truck! License plate  AWP82092.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the truck with the California plate AWP82092. OUR  VIEW RISES UP until we're looking at an AERIAL VIEW as th three armored trucks and their motorcycles fan out in thr different directions, with the Ferrari going in a fourth  direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handsome Rob pulls up in his Mini and parks behind the ot Minis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie gives the command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gridlock time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle executes, hitting a series of keys and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: inconspicuous on a shelf, the dummy file box CLICKS into  action. In response, the false panels on the mainframes H to life and in the adjacent --

dialogues.speaker: TRAFFIC CONTROL CENTER
dialogues.text: The mosaic of traffic screens SPIRAL INTO DARKNESS. The workers can't believe it. They start hitting their  keyboards trying to get the system up and running again. it's useless since --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle controls the system now. A single mouse click loads new algorithm into the computer and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the traffic signals in Hollywood turn green  simultaneously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See cars collide into each other. See a domino line of re end crashes. A motorcycle tumbling over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stymied workers watch helplessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle quickly types out some words and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The workers see the words form on the giant screens: YOU'LL NEVER SHUT DOWN THE REAL NAPSTER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The traffic lights turn RED simultaneously. Then all turn GREEN. Then RED again. It's demolition derby time. Daisy-chains of wrecks. Cars  spinning like hockey pucks. Total traffic meltdown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweeping over a panoramic view of the greatest traffic ja in L.A.'s history is traffic anchor CHRISTINA GRIEGO. She reports what she sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Christina Griego with your  drive-home traffic report on KNX.  I'm looking down on Hollywood  Boulevard and this is definitely a  CIG alert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're blocked in solid ahead and behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns on the radio as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle's fingers dance across the keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opening up a space on North Highland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuck in the middle of it. The driver and guard, both arm are as confused as everyone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get us out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees a way out, a sudden opening on North. Highland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Via a traffic video camera, Lyle sees on his laptop the g truck, followed by two motorcycles, making the turn onto  North Highland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's taking it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle hits more keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I now command you to turn left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It comes to the next intersection. Every light is stuck o red -- except the left turn only signal which is green. N choice. The truck takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's striking keys, an orchestral conductor, the crew his audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got it on Hollywood Boulevard.  Time to slow down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Signals turn green, but only for three seconds, long enou for one car to gun through it at a time. At the same time, we see Charlie get out of the U-Haul an climb into the first Mini. Stella gets into the second Mi Half-Ear joins Handsome Rob in the third.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve gets the scoop over the radio. He can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to the police, the computers  at the Traffic Control Center are  down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve knows who did that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonovabitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through his rearview mirror, Charlie eyes the gold truck  creeping closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, start your engines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starting their engines-with souped-up, throaty roars: Cha Handsome Rob; Stella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give us the flag when you're ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle has hacked into the Metro Rail's Control System. Sta his magic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutting down the rail as we speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Metro is speeding through the Blue Line tunnel. Suddenl it loses power and comes to an inglorious stop. Another Metro stops on the Red Line. Inside a Metro on the Westside Corridor as it stops; conf passengers stare out the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His laptop shows a group of still circles that represent stalled Metros.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tunnel's clear. Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three Minis jump the curb and drive right over the st lined sidewalk... Pedestrians throw themselves out of the path... The cars run over Marilyn Monroe's star and the  flowers and candles left by fans... They make a sharp tur down the cement stairs that lead to the Metro Rail platfo At the same time --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creeping gold truck is just about alongside the parke Haul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through his sideview mirror, Lyle eyes the progress of th gold truck. He gives the word:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming into position...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Minis roughly bounce down the second flight of stairs The sides of the cars scrape against the metal handrails. Tourists, workers, all scamper away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gold truck getting closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five... Four...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Minis land on the platform where everyone is waiting the next Metro. Heads turn at the sight of these half-cars streaking by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gold truck is almost alongside the U-Haul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie's Mini flies off the platform and lands on the ra line. The car's shocks take the hit. The other Minis follow suit, off the platform, onto the r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two... One...

dialogues.speaker: THE MINIS
dialogues.text: Drive past the spot where they put the Nitramon explosive

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She brakes to a stop and braces herself as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half-Ear pulls out his hearing aid, hits the remote to a  detonator and -- EXT. HOLLYWOOD & HIGHLAND The section of pavement that the gold truck sits on split apart. The road surface drops away. Smoke billowing up as The BRINK'S TRUCK FALLS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the street, the armored truck and daylight come  crashing down at us in a cloud of smoke and debris. The truck's windshield implodes. The Minis come to a stop. Half-Ear jumps out. Aims the gr launcher. FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The triple charger chemical grenade sails in through the  windshield and explodes, knocking out the guards. The dri slumps against the steering wheel, the horn BLARING under his weight. At the same time:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle hits a button on a remote control and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clamps unlock, releasing the heavy steel sheet from the s of the U-Haul. It SLAMS DOWN, neatly covering the gaping  hole in the road like a huge manhole cover. EXT. HOLLYWOOD & HIGHLAND The motorcycles following the Brink's come to a sudden st The motorcycle guards watch the smoke clear. The armored  truck has vanished! Vaporized in the gridlock! Gone! Pandemonium. People scatter. A man jumps out of his BMW a sprints away from the explosion. Lyle gets out of the U-Haul and runs to his getaway vehic the Vespa. He's about to hop on, but something stops him. The sight of the vacant, shimmering, 2002 BMW 750iL parke just ahead, keys dangling from the ignition. At the same time, the motorcycle guards climb off their b Draw semi-automatic handguns. Result: more madness Bystan flee. The BMW tears out of there, Lyle behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rear door to the Brink's is open. Our crew sees the  Worthington 1000 inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well like Einstein almost said: genius  is ten percent inspiration, ninety  percent detonation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get our gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella goes up to the imposing safe. Gives it a look of  momentary respect, then sets to work...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christina Griego telling her radio audience:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen earthquakes, mudslides,  fires, riots, but this... Let me try  to paint a picture for our listeners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing the news over the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's been some kind of an explosion  and a Brink's truck has just dropped  down into the Metro Rail Blue Line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve slams the car into gear and jumps the sidewalk, pas the gridlock. He hollers into a walkie-talkie --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck's in the Metro Rail. Where  does the Blue Line go back above  ground?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motorcycle guards who were escorting the decoy trucks hear Steve over their walkie-talkies. With squeals of rub they turn around as one of the guards answers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It comes out at Flower & Pico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the same time --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella works the dial, feeling for contact points. And -- EXT. HOLLYWOOD & HIGHLAND - DAY The two motorcycle guards fervently try to lift off the s sheet that dropped down from the U-Haul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They see daylight start to stream in from above as the st sheet slides a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR Stella's heart pounding in her ears. See the  perspiration on her fingertips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know when you said this wouldn't  be the same as opening a safe for  the cops?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you have to be right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. HOLLYWOOD & HIGHLAND - DAY The motorcycle guards strain, managing to shift the steel sheet enough so they can see the armored truck below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE SHOTS on Stella's eyes, pure concentration. CLOSE S on each number on the dial. Finally: CLICK. She grabs the safe's lever and swings the sturdy steel do open. She instinctively looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you want to see what's inside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me. You wanna look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So she does. Inside is a mountain of gold bricks... EXT. HOLLYWOOD & HIGHLAND - MOMENTS LATER The motorcycle guards heave, strain, finally getting the  steel plate off. But it's too late as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engines REV. Exhaust jets. Hands slam stick-shifts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cars streak off deeper into the Metro Rail tunnel,  headlights bouncing off the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a rush cruising down the tunnel. Taking the Blue Lin Leading the pack. But they're not home free yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rush hour gridlock -- no problem. The Ferrari's 12 cylind massive 210 hp engine bellows as it hits 120 m.p.h. in th breakdown lane. A Highway Patrol car starts chasing after it, siren waili

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merging onto the 110 South, Steve sees the patrol car in pursuit. He shifts into sixth and suddenly this car is a rocket  blasting off, doing a 1/4 mile in 1.3 seconds, leaving th patrol car far behind. At the same time --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mashkov and the other heavily armed Ukrainians climb into SUV. The garage door opens and the vehicle charges out of there. And at the same time --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three Minis speed by UNDERNEATH OUR CAMERA in streaks red, white, and blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spots the proverbial daylight at the end of the tunnel EXT. FLOWER & PICO - DAY Where the Blue Line rises up to ground level. The Minis  thunder into the daylight, past the above ground platform just as two motorcycles come flying around the corner aft them. Picture this: two guards on each motorcycle with each man seated behind the driver holding AK-47s in each hand, giv them the appearance of having submachine guns growing out their shoulders. Fingers go flat against the AK-47s triggers. Blowing SHOT after SHOT at the Minis. BAM-BAM-BAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the teeth of gunfire. Bullets explode through the back window in a cacophony of CRASHING GLASS. A shot wings his door. POP! Into headset:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Split up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. FLOWER & PICO They head off in different directions through congested  downtown rush hour traffic. One motorcycle takes off after Charlie's Mini. The other  goes after Handsome Rob's Mini. So Stella's free and clea except that Steve's Ferrari is barreling down Pico and co after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An LAPD PILOT swoops in, barking out instructions to poli cars converging on the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turning onto Exposition, the motorcycle in pursuit, the  chopper overhead. His red Mini jumps a curve, now on a wide sidewalk,  accelerating full throttle for the horizon while pedestri flatten themselves against a high-rise in fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees someone give him the finger. Mutters:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't like how I'm driving,  get off the damn sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got the other motorcycle on his tail, RELENTLESS GUN dogging his every move. He shifts smooth as silk, squeezing between a car he's pa and an oncoming car in the other lane. Half-Ear is trying his best to remain calm but Jesus, that was close. Suddenly, Handsome Rob veers off the road and WHAM. He ta down a chain link fence and is now in the parking lot of  the:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His white Mini catapults across the asphalt, the motorcyc still right behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up ahead, he eyes the open door entrance to the Conventio Center. Stomps the gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The turbine howls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What -- are -- you -- doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mini squeezes through the doorway and into the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the STAR TREK GRAND SLAM 2002 convention in full swi Display tables are lined up in the cavernous hall and the Mini snakes through the maze and the Trekkies as -- The motorcycle follows right behind and the chase is real on now. THUDA THUD THUDA, the Mini's wheels climb a flight of ste Waves of people flee the path of the little car and -- THUD, THUDA, THUD, the motorcycle follows right behind. The Mini zips down the wide Concourse Hall -- travels  underneath banners of Star Trek characters that hang from the ceiling -- the motorcycle keeps up, tires tearing int the carpeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shifts, swerves, avoiding people, obstacles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go that way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handsome Rob turns, taking them down the --

dialogues.speaker: WEST HALL
dialogues.text: that stretches out toward the Staples Center. WHIZ. The Mini goes by. WHIZ. The motorcycle goes by. Then -- The Mini steamrolls through the exit doors and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It bounds down outdoor steps and ramps onto the outside  entrance to the Staples Center, fitting snugly between ce pillars that are designed to keep regular-sized cars out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mini bulldozes through glass doors. Across the lobby. Down an aisle that leads right to --

dialogues.speaker: CENTER COURT
dialogues.text: where OUR L.A. LAKERS are in the midst of practice. The M do look like matchbox cars next to these towering players The car's tires leave a streak of rubber on the parquet f The team clears a path. The car is off the court before t know it. But now the players see the motorcycle coming down the ai See the guns. See security guards running after it. KOBE BRYANT picks up a basketball. The motorcycle charges across center court. Kobe aims... hurls the ball. It RAMS into the motorcycle' handlebars. The bike spins out of control and into a nast fall, spitting off the riders while --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mini crashes out the opposite side of the arena and g right through the L.A. Sports Arch of Fame before escapin onto Figueroa. Meanwhile:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ferrari is eating up the pavement as it hounds after  Stella. Two police cars are roaring after them both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slaps the gears into action, maneuvers tight turns ar the cars in her path, just like she does at home with Jac Daniels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cop car tries to pass the same car as the Ferrari but  smashes into an oncoming vehicle. As it spins like a cork

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rear tires spin smoke and it launches like a missile  after the Mini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She keeps flooring it... the gauge rising... the customiz engine screaming... But the Ferrari, like an unstoppable force, hangs menacin in her rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: I/E FERRARI
dialogues.text: Steve RAMS into the rear bumper of the blue Mini. The bum tears off, rolls across the pavement. The Ferrari is abou to make another charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She yanks the wheel left to avoid the hit. Suddenly finds herself in the path of an ARROWHEAD WATER TRUCK. She yank the wheel right to avoid a collision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck driver hits the brakes, over compensating as he turns away from the Mini and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck falls over onto its side, sending those big jug all over the road, water exploding into the air and -- The Ferrari crashes through the jugs, one rolling up the  hood and over the windshield, dousing it like a car wash. The lane is blocked by the wreck. Steve makes a right tur The police cruiser hits the brakes but not fast enough. I slams into the water truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve turned onto a one-way street and he's going the wro way. A Jeep Wrangler almost runs into him head-on but bot cars stop just in time. The DRIVER of Wrangler, a muscular fire plug of a guy, ju out, furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with you, you stupid- ass, son of a bitch, dickhead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As more invectives are hurled, Steve gets out of the Ferr and walks towards the furious driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You want a piece of me? C'mon,  dumbshit. Bring it on. I'll be pulling  peanuts out of your asshole --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG. Steve shoots the guy's foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Shit! You shot me in the foot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While the furious driver hops on one leg, Steve gets into the Wrangler and takes off, abandoning the Ferrari. At th same time --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle's coasting down Exposition Boulevard towards Union  Station. Clear sailing for him. He sees a young woman thumbing for a ride. It's Karen. An he recognizes her: she was hitchhiking when he first arri in L.A. He pulls over. To Lyle, she might be an angel in empyrean if she wasn't, so completely, a woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about far, far away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The farther the better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. FIGUEROA & OLYMPIC - DAY Charlie's still having a helluva time getting rid of the  motorcycle. It screams like a Banshee as it streaks up  alongside the Mini. Charlie suddenly sees an AK-47 pointe right at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jerks the steering wheel and swerves off the street,  driving through the parking lot of the historic Hotel  Figueroa. With the motorcycle dogging his heels, he looks up at the building. It has three towers that rise up 12 stories, wi a giant mural of Albert Einstein covering one of the towe (it's an ad for Apple Computers: Think different.) Suddenly the LAPD helicopter swoops down towards the park lot, shattering the air, blowing up dirt and discarded  newspapers in a rush of turbo-wash, trying to box in the  Mini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got no place else to go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mini squeezes through the entrance and into the lobby with its exotic Moroccan decor. Horrified guests catapult out of the way. The Mini drives past wooden statues, pott palm trees. The motorcycle follows the car as it streaks towards the  elevator. Charlie looks back, sees the motorcycle. The  elevator door opens. Some tourists step off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mini darts right in, not an inch to spare. Charlie re out the window, presses the button for ROOF. He sees the motorcycle charging after him, burning rubber across the beautiful tiled floor. Closer, closer. The door closes just in time. A second elevator opens, the motorcycle zooms inside, peo screaming at the sight of the guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors open, PING, and the Mini reverses out, spins. LOOKING DOWN onto the building's rooftop, we see that it shaped like a capitol E, three towers connected by a narr strip. Each tower has its own elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to drive across the rooftop strip but there's a problem: the giant sign that exclaims HOTEL FIGUEROA in r and white neon lights blocks so much of the strip that ev the Mini couldn't squeeze through. In his rearview, he sees the second elevator door open an out comes the motorcycle. He's trapped up here. But he's about to abandon ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he floors it, slaps the gears, hurtles to the edge of first tower and in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His car hurls into the wide blue empty space... The groun deliriously distant... Spiraling through the air like a  football...

dialogues.speaker: NEXT TOWER
dialogues.text: The Mini lands right-side-up with a THUD. Charlie, rattle looks over his shoulder and sees the LAPD helicopter risi over the rooftop, turbines SCREAMING. And here comes the motorcycle. Flying from one section of the rooftop to the next. It lands and the driver REVS it  forward --

dialogues.speaker: I/E CHARLIE'S MINI
dialogues.text: He speeds toward the edge of the roof and launches off to the third tower some twenty feet away. Lands. Keeps going the last elevator, skids to a stop. He reaches out, punches the call button. Then looks over shoulder to witness --

dialogues.speaker: THE MOTORCYCLE
dialogues.text: going full throttle to make the final rooftop to rooftop  jump. But its front wheel hits the edge slightly off-kilter... It soars but with a slight downward trajectory... Towards a large window on the top floor... Then lower... And the look on the driver's face says it all as... The front wheel of the motorcycle SMACKS into the side of the building, just below the window. The guards are flung off the bike and their bodies CRASH  through the window as -- A hunk of exploding metal imbeds itself in the side of th LAPD chopper and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guards land in the Tangier Suite in a hailstorm of gl shards.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. LAPD HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Smoke billows out where the hunk of metal hit. The pilot  keeps it under control but it's time to go. With a WHININ THROB, the injured chopper banks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PING. The elevator door opens. Charlie's Mini shoots out  then skids out the lobby's exit. He made it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She checks the rearview mirror. No sign of the Ferrari. Just a Jeep Wrangler back there. Stella looks relieved. Feels like she's home free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella's Mini pulls up to the ramp of the enclosed car ca at the end of Amtrak Train 59, bound for New Orleans. She can see the other two Minis are already inside. She g out and hands the cargo loader a ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "All Aboard" announcement goes out over the PA system Then the Superliner train pulls out of the station, quick picking up speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The outside streaks by through the window. It's a happy c Champagne is poured. Charlie holds up his glass and gets  their attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to make a toast. Cause there's  somebody missing here today, and we  all know who it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all raise their glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To John Bridger. The most brilliant  master planner of them all. We wish  he was with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PAN ACROSS their faces. It's been a three year odyssey for them. They got the gold, but they lost someone they l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OUR CAMERA MOVES past the three Minis parked inside... And STOPS at the last car in the carrier -- the Jeep Wran Its rear hatch rises and Steve creeps out. Looks around.  It's safe. He walks over to Stella's Mini. Pops open the trunk REVEA a silver Haliburton suitcase. He unzips the case. It's filled with stacks and stacks of gold bricks, the ex face of a Balinese girl on each one. Steve pulls out a brick, embraces it. He knows his gold. These bricks are real. But as he has a moment with his gold, BEHIND HIM, the tru of the other two Minis RISE in unison. Then Mashkov RISES out of the trunk of the white Mini. Another Ukrainian RISES out of the trunk of the blue Mini Four more Ukrainians slide out from underneath the Minis. They cock their M-lls. CLICK CLICK CLICK CLICK CLICK CLICK. Steve hears the sound from behind him. He turns around to see the weapons pointed at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take out your gun and drop it on the  floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve has no choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew my cousin. Yevhen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never knew anyone named Yevhen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the trunk. Not that trunk,  this one. That gold is for us. A  gift from some old friends of yours.  They said to tell you that they didn't  mind sharing the box of Cracker Jack,  as long as you didn't get any. Not  even the toy surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ukrainians force Steve into the trunk of the white Mi And for the first time, he's scared. Looking up at Mashko he begs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Don't shoot me. Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. That wasn't the deal.  I'm not going to shoot you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Thank God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the others) He really thought I was going to  shoot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ukrainians laugh. Steve tries to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No. I'm not going to shoot you.  I'm going to hack off your limbs and  bury you while you're still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, he closes the trunk. THUD. Like the lid of coffin. And for Steve, the world falls into BLACKNESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Underneath the crew's seats, we see the other two silver  Haliburton suitcases filled with the rest of the gold. We BOOM UP to our five thieves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New IDs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handsome Rob passes out new fake driver's licenses for wh they arrive in New Orleans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: his fake license) Simon Quackenbush? Could I -- just  once -- have a cool name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (also complaining) 250_pounds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're interrupted by the RING of Charlie's phone. He  answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get what you wanted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mashkov is on the other end of the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During this, Lyle types commands into his laptop that is  connected to a phone jack in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was good doing business with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle hits a final command and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: signal box receives the command and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coupler between the car carrier and the rest of the t is electronically disengaged. This causes the train to separate from the car carrier. T train speeds on without it at 100 miles per hour. The car carrier slowly comes to a stop in the middle of  nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dining Car features crisp white linens and extended  windows for scenic dining. Lyle walks over to a table whe Karen is waiting for him. She looks resplendent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this seat taken?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits. And as OUR CAMERA HOLDS ON Lyle, ready to embark a new life, we --

dialogues.speaker: THE COVER OF WIRED MAGAZINE
dialogues.text: It fills THE SCREEN. And beneath a photograph of Lyle him we read the headline: WILL THE REAL NAPSTER PLEASE STAND UP How The Laptop Fugitive Pulled It Off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as OUR CAMERA FINDS Half-Ear, checking out the books the library, feeling like the wealthy man he is, we --

dialogues.speaker: THE COVER OF PHILADELPHIA CITY COLLEGE'S ALUMNI NEWS
dialogues.text: And beneath a graduation photo of Half-Ear in his cap and gown, we read the headline: "HE WAS ONE OF M'S BEST STUDENTS" Professor Relives Memories of Erudite Fugitive

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as OUR CAMERA FINDS Handsome Rob, who's already caugh the eye of a woman at the bar, we --

dialogues.speaker: THE COVER OF THE ADELPHIA CABLE INSIDER NEWSLETTER
dialogues.text: And beneath a photo of Becky the cable chick, we read the headline:

dialogues.speaker: "HE TOOK THE SHIRT OFF MY BACK AND I'D GIVE IT TO HIM AGA
dialogues.text: Feds Say Technician Admits to Encounter With 'Handsome' T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie and Stella drink from glasses of champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We sure did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something I've been meaning  to ask you, Stella. But I've just  been so busy lately, what with the  explosion, car chase, Ukrainians and  all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has been a hectic day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about that thing you said to me  back in Philadelphia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said that you can't have a  relationship with a pickpocket, gold  robber, or any kind of thief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... That thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you still believe that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I was wondering... What about a  retired pickpocket, gold robber,  thief?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that's an entirely different  question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as an enigmatic smile settles across her face, we --

dialogues.speaker: THE COVER OF CONDE MAST TRAVEL MAGAZINE
dialogues.text: And beneath a photo of sunbathers on a glorious beach, we read the headline: LIVING THE GOOD LIFE ON THE PINK SANDS OF BERMUDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And OUR VIEW SLOWLY PUSHES IN CLOSER ON the magazine cove CLOSER on the line of sunbathers... PANNING ACROSS their  faces -- and you'd never notice unless you were really,  really, looking for them... is it them?... CLOSER on the  pixels... and yes, it sure is... Charlie & Stella in chairs, living the good life.
